content: Ok, this may not be the issue, but it's worth checking. You have three gmail accounts. Do you have three SMTP servers? Do they each have unique descriptions in the description field for each? Have you checked each account setting pane to verify that each is linked to a unique SMTP server? I say this because the problem only began when you added the third account. Getting SMTP servers mixed up is a common situation.
creator: davidsk

content:
If you just want to do that once, or occasionally, you can simply copy the messages in your gmail inbox to a new folder you create under your "Local Folders", and then delete them on the server. (first part will take some time, though)

After that, to always copy new messages to your folder under "Local Folders", you could set up a message filter for your gmail account that just copies all new messages to your local folder. (Tools -> Message filters). Once you're confident that the filter works, you can start regularly deleting messages from your gmail inbox (or even change your filter to directly move them to the local folder).

But keep in mind that then the only copies of your messages will exist on your local disk. So if there is any important stuff in that inbox, be sure to make regular backups.
creator: public25

creator: davidsk

content:
Not quite sure what it is that you've tried, but here's how I would do it:

  1. Got to Tools -> Message filters
  2. Click "New"
  3. Add a filter name, select when to run ("Manually run" and "Getting new mail" seems a good start)
  4. Select "Match any of the following"
  5. In the left-most dropdown select "Customize"
  6. Under "New message header" enter "Reply-To", click "Add", click "OK"
  7. Back on the previous window, select "Reply-To" in the left-most dropdown
  8. Select "contains" in the middle dropdown
  9. Enter "@topcollection.online" in the right-most input field
  10. Under "Perform these actions" select what should happen (Delete Message or Move Message to ... etc.)
  11. Click "OK" and make sure the new filter is enabled (checkbox ticked)

That should do it. I seem to remember cases where I had to restart thunderbird before the filter was applied automatically.

Best /m
